The game mechanics are solid enough to provide a very responsive and competitive experience, or a fun and casual one if you use the server browser and manage to find any of the vast amounts of special gamemodes people have come up with.

I've been playing Counter-Strike on and off for about 17 years...Thats pretty ridiculous to be honest.

But really what I enjoy about it at the end of the day is the lack of progression incentives ala the Call of Duty series, and the consistent balanced baseline of gameplay. Skill is what the game is all about, not some dumbass game breaking gun added through DLC or cheesy bullshit mechanics. Raw, balanced gameplay. Fundamentally and old-school game at heart.
